newsitem.title: USA: Machinists union opposes American, BA alliance.
newsitem.headline: Machinists union opposes American, BA alliance.

text.p: The 110,000-member machinists union said on Wednesday it opposed the planned alliance between American Airlines, an unit of AMR Corp., and British Airways Plc..

The International Association of Machinists said in a letter to President Clinton that the link between the two big airlines would result in substantial economic harm to airlines that employ its members as well as to the traveling public.

IAM international president George Kourpias urged Clinton, and Transportation Secretary Federico Pena, to give close scrutiny to the proposed link, "which we believe is in fact, a monopolistic merger by another name."
The Transportation Department must grant antitrust immunity to the alliance before it can go into effect.
Kourpias said the alliance could effectively destroy transatlantic competition and union members would suffer.

He said the long-time competitors already enjoy unfair advantage over other airlines, including access to the limited gates at London Heathrow airport, and if their alliance were approved, would capture even greater market share.
Kourpias said that an alliance, if approved, would "foreclose rivals, limit capacity and raise fares."
